import unittest
from unittest.mock import Mock, patch, MagicMock, ANY
from requests.exceptions import RequestException
from requests import HTTPError

class TestApiDataRetriever(SparkSessionBaseClass):

    @classmethod
    def setUpClass(cls):
        super().setUpClass()
        cls.params = {
            "api_name": "my_api",
            "api_host_name": "http://my-api-hostname.com",
            "version": "v1",
            "record_count_to_request": 10
        }
    
    def setUp(self):
        # Setup code before each test method
        super().setUp()
        self.table_actions = Mock()
        self.telemetry_client = Mock()
        self.table_service_client = Mock()
        self.api_processor = Mock()
        self.token_auth = Mock()

    @patch.object(AzureTableClient, "retrieve_cursor")
    @patch.object(TokenAuthenticator, "get_auth_token_iterator")
    def test_retrieve_data_from_api(self, mock_retrieve_cursor, mock_authenticator):
        table_actions = Mock()
        telemetry_client = Mock()
        table_service_client = Mock()
        api_processor = Mock()
        token_auth = Mock()

        # Define mock objects and values
        with patch("requests.Session.get") as mock_get:
            # Example usage:
            tokens = ["token1", "token2", "token3"]
            mock_iterator = iter(tokens)

            token_auth.get_auth_token_iterator = MagicMock(return_value = mock_iterator)
            # Arrange
            mock_response = MagicMock()
            mock_response.status_code = 200
            mock_response.raise_for_status = MagicMock()

            # Mock the return values for patched methods
            mock_get.return_value = mock_response
            mock_retrieve_cursor.return_value = "mock_current_cursor"
            mock_authenticator.return_value = TestMockTokenAuthenticator.mock_token
            
            api_retriever = ApiDataRetriever(
                params=self.params,
                table_actions=table_actions,
                telemetry_client=telemetry_client,
                table_service_client=table_service_client,
                api_processor=api_processor,
                token_authenticator=token_auth
                )

            # Act
            # Call the method under test
            api_retriever.retrieve_data_from_api()

            # Assert that the expected methods were called on mock objects
            api_retriever.telemetry_client.track_event.assert_called_with('Completed ingestion logic for my_api.')
            api_retriever.table_service_client.retrieve_cursor.assert_called_once_with(partition_key='my_api', row_key='my_api', property_name='NextIngestionCursor')

            expected_log_count = 13
            actual_log_count = api_retriever.telemetry_client.track_event.call_count

            log_count_msg = f"Expected {expected_log_count} track_event() calls. Result was {actual_log_count}"
            assert actual_log_count == expected_log_count, log_count_msg

            expected_retrieve_cursor_count = 1
            actual_retrieve_cursor_count = api_retriever.table_service_client.retrieve_cursor.call_count

            # Assert the number of times table_service_client.retrieve_cursor was called
            retrieve_cursor_count_msg = f"Expected {expected_retrieve_cursor_count} retrieve cursor count calls. Result was {actual_retrieve_cursor_count}"

            assert actual_retrieve_cursor_count == expected_retrieve_cursor_count, retrieve_cursor_count_msg

    @patch.object(AzureTableClient, "retrieve_cursor")
    @patch.object(TokenAuthenticator, "get_auth_token_iterator")
    def test_retrieve_data_no_records(self, mock_retrieve_cursor, mock_authenticator):
        table_actions = Mock()
        telemetry_client = Mock()
        table_service_client = Mock()
        api_processor = Mock()
        token_auth = Mock()

        with patch("requests.Session.get") as mock_get:

            tokens = ["token1", "token2", "token3"]
            mock_iterator = iter(tokens)

            # token_auth.get_auth_token = MagicMock(return_value = "mock_token")
            token_auth.get_auth_token_iterator = MagicMock(return_value = mock_iterator)
            # Arrange
            mock_response = MagicMock()
            mock_response.status_code = 200
            mock_response.raise_for_status = MagicMock()
            mock_response.json.return_value = {"updateSequence": [], "nextCursor": "new_cursor"}

            # Mock the return values for patched methods
            mock_get.return_value = mock_response
            mock_retrieve_cursor.return_value = "mock_current_cursor"
            mock_authenticator.return_value = TestMockTokenAuthenticator.mock_token
            
            api_retriever = ApiDataRetriever(
                params=self.params,
                table_actions=table_actions,
                telemetry_client=telemetry_client,
                table_service_client=table_service_client,
                api_processor=api_processor,
                token_authenticator=token_auth            
		)

            # Act
            # Call the method under test
            api_retriever.retrieve_data_from_api()

            # Assert that the expected methods were called on mock objects
            api_retriever.telemetry_client.track_event.assert_called_with('Completed ingestion logic for my_api.')
            api_retriever.table_service_client.retrieve_cursor.assert_called_with(partition_key='my_api', row_key='my_api', property_name='NextIngestionCursor')

            expected_log_count = 13
            actual_log_count = api_retriever.telemetry_client.track_event.call_count

            log_count_msg = f"Expected {expected_log_count} track_event() calls. Result was {actual_log_count}"
            assert actual_log_count == expected_log_count, log_count_msg

            expected_retrieve_cursor_count = 1
            actual_retrieve_cursor_count = api_retriever.table_service_client.retrieve_cursor.call_count

            # Assert the number of times table_service_client.retrieve_cursor was called
            retrieve_cursor_count_msg = f"Expected {expected_retrieve_cursor_count} retrieve cursor count calls. Result was {actual_retrieve_cursor_count}"

            assert actual_retrieve_cursor_count == expected_retrieve_cursor_count, retrieve_cursor_count_msg
